content:
For instance to contrast this with the Rust community packaging was recognized as an important thing and a community project (cargo) for packaging was made part of the language development. In the Python world these efforts are always separate.

Yes, this is one of my favorite parts of Rust! I originally did a lot of Python programming but this is one of the reasons I almost always prefer Rust
Armin is pretty well known in the Rust community, gave many talks about rust in several conferences.
That's funny, I didn't realize there was an overlap :)
I wonder what the most common primary language other than Rust was among Rustaceans. If I had to guess, I would say Python. (I'm excluding shell languages and the like)
they wrote some popular rust crates such as https://github.com/mitsuhiko/dialoguer and https://github.com/mitsuhiko/indicatif
I've used indicatif and Flask and I didn't realize they were by the same person! :laughing:
